page.title: 19LOCAL MYTHS AND LEGENDS
page.content: Legends in Worthing's proximity:- At first site,the Worthing area does not seem to be a very inspiring place for legends,but looks can be deceptive.Right in the heart of Worthing,for instance,once stood an oak tree.From beneath it,it was said, skeletons rose on Midsummer Eve and danced hand in hand around the tree until cock crow.The tree's site is now a triangle of land in the road intersection at the end of Broadwater Green.Further afield,we have a Shoreham murderer whose hands still strangle anyone who sleeps in a partcular bed in a guest house,and a monk who haunts Meeting House Lane in Brighton.Other ghost stories in our immediate proximity include that of the 'Black Abbot' which supposedly haunts Sompting Abbotts school.Two ghosts also haunt Lancing College.
